content.question: Assume an economy is in long-run equilibrium. If there is an increase in short-run aggregate supply, how will it be demonstrated in the Phillips curve model?

choices.label: A movement along the short-run Phillips curve to the left of long-run equilibrium
A movement along the short-run Phillips curve to the right of long-run equilibrium
A shift of the short-run Phillips curve to the left
A shift of the short-run Phillips curve to the right
A shift of the long-run Phillips curve to the right

content.answer: A shift of the short-run Phillips curve to the left

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine the outcome of an economic situation using economic concepts, principles, or models.
